ref_item.label: Control
ref_item.description: Participate in technology-enabled care without regret lottery
interventionNames: Behavioral: Way to Health technology enhanced care

pred_item.label: Control arm
pred_item.description: Participants received activity trackers and daily text message reminders to increase physical activity.

ref_item.label: Experimental
ref_item.description: Participate in technology-enabled care with regret lottery
interventionNames: Behavioral: Way to Health technology enhanced care

pred_item.label: Intervention arm
pred_item.description: Participants received activity trackers and daily text message reminders plus a weekly regret lottery.

ref_item.name: Regret lottery
ref_item.description: Subjects who achieve step goals are entered into a lottery in which they can win a financial incentive of $30 or $100.

pred_item.name: Regret Lottery
pred_item.description: Participants who met their activity goal had a chance to win a small ($30) or large ($100) gift card incentive; those who did not meet their goals were informed of what they would have won had they met their goal.

ref_item.name: Way to Health technology enhanced care
ref_item.description: Subjects receive text reminders to reach activity goals.

pred_item.name: Daily Text Message Reminders
pred_item.description: Daily text messages reminding the subject to engage in physical activity and to achieve their weekly goals.

ref_item.description: Stanford Exercise Questionnaire; min score = 0, max score = 180; higher scores = better outcome

pred_item.description: Measured using the Stanford 7-Day Physical Activity Recall Questionnaire (PAR), assessing time spent engaged in stretching/strengthening activities and aerobic activities.

ref_item.description: steps per day measured by wearable step tracker at 12 weeks

pred_item.description: Measured by the number of steps recorded using a Fitbit activity tracker.

ref_item.description: measured by opioid morphine mg equivalents used each day (MED)

pred_item.description: Extracted from the electronic health record (formulation, dose, and quantity) for the previous 24-hours, calculated as daily buprenorphine dose or morphine milligram equivalents (MME) for other opioids.

ref_item.description: measured by interference with walking on PROMIS (Patient-reported Outcomes Measurement Information System) pain interference tool, which is a 6-item self-report survey; each item is scored from 1 (not at all) to 5 (very much), thus scores ranged from 6 to 30, with higher score indicating more pain interference.

pred_item.description: Measured by the Pain Outcomes Questionnaire assessing interference with walking/ADLs, vitality, negative affect, and fears of injury on a scale of 0 (not at all) to 10 (all the time).

ref_item.description: measured by pain severity on PROMIS (Patient-reported Outcomes Measurement Information System) pain severity tool, which is a 3-item self-report survey; each item is scored from 1 (no pain at all) to 5 (very severity), thus scores ranged from 3 to 15, with higher score indicating more severe pain.

pred_item.description: Measured using the Pain Outcomes Questionnaire on a scale of 0 (no pain at all) to 10 (worst possible pain).
